ETYMOLOGY: From Ancient Greek hierarkhia (ἱεραρχία), from hierarkhes (ἱεράρχης, 'ruler of sacred rites'), from hieros (ἱερός, 'sacred') + arkhein (ἄρχειν, 'to rule').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A system or organization in which people or groups are ranked one above the other according to status or authority.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种根据地位或权威将人或事物进行等级排列的系统或组织。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The company has a strict hierarchy, from the CEO down to the interns.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 公司有着严格的等级制度，从首席执行官到实习生。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A body of ecclesiastical rulers, especially in an episcopal church.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: (尤指在主教制教会中)由教士组成的统治机构；教士等级制度。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The Catholic Church is governed by a complex hierarchy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 天主教会由复杂的教士等级制度管理。

REGISTER: Formal; commonly used in academic, business, organizational, and religious contexts.
